title: Sheldon Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Brian Robert Marshall, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Sheldon Country Park, Elmdon, Birmingham. The parkland acts as a buffer between a municipal housing area out of shot to the left and Birmingham International Airport (BHX) ditto to the right.

images.title: Brian Robert Marshall, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Access point to country park, Greenvale Avenue, Elmdon This sturdy-looking structure is presumably intended to restrict access to the parkland to pedestrians (including mums with children in pushchairs).

images.title: Carl Baker / Sheldon country park
images.caption: The end of the runway at Birmingham Airport viewed from Sheldon country park.

images.title: Carl Baker / Entrance to Sheldon Country Park
images.caption: A dog at the entrance to Sheldon Country Park. Birmingham Airport is to the left and the main Birmingham to London railway line is to the right.

images.title: Sheldon Country Park Tea Rooms, Ragley Drive by Christine Johnstone, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Sheldon Country Park Tea Rooms, Ragley Drive

images.caption: Downstream on the Westley Brook

images.caption: The church of St Giles. Located right next to the park is this fine old church.

images.title: Sheep in Sheldon again by Christine Johnstone, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Sheep in a field in the spring month of May.

description: A short walk or cycle through the pretty Sheldon Country Park in Birmingham. The park covers just over 300 acres and includes open grassland, wetlands and mature woodland. There is also a restored Rectory Farm with Jersey cattle, pigs, goats, ponies, ducks, chickens and geese. A local cycle route runs through the park as does the Solihull Way walking route. This can be followed to the nearby Kingfisher Country Park . The route outlined below also runs onto the nearby Elmdon Park and House which is worth seeing if you have time. The park is located next to Birmingham International Airport, near to the NEC.
